Key Match Events: Aaron Judge crushed a 445-footer to dead-red center for No. 53 in the third inning.
Gerrit Cole hit three batters in his 4 ¹/₃ innings of work.
Boston starter Brayan Bello's first pitch darted behind Aaron Judge's legs before Judge lined out to deep center.
Pre-Game Insights: Boston manager Alex Cora admitted prior to Sunday's game that the Red Sox had tried to hit Aaron Judge with a pitch in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone said that Cora's declaration was 'for someone else to deal with.'
Aaron Judge called his postgame conversation with Alex Cora 'a good convo, let's leave it at that.'
Yankees manager Aaron Boone took responsibility for the breakdown of communications in the dugout.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees took three out of four and finished the homestand with a three-game division lead over the Orioles.
Gleyber Torres continued to rake from the leadoff spot.
The remade bullpen did the job.
Others: The incident may become a peculiar footnote in the history of The Rivalry.
The Yankees' 5-2 victory was a good day for manager Aaron Boone's team.
